;

;Liangshan, Sichuan, Atuleer Village, Zhiermo Township, Zhaojue County, a local Villagers live broadcast on their way down the mountain. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;The last time fans learned about the fate of these Daliangshan Internet celebrities who suddenly disappeared was in 2023 At the press conference of Liangshan’s “Series of Internet Celebrities Live Broadcasting Cases” on September 20, 2019, they were no longer able to update their daily life videos as usual. Recently, many Internet celebrities in Liangshan Prefecture, Sichuan Province have been jailed for false advertising and selling fake goods.

;

;In the days after the shock, the aftermath still affected the live broadcast rooms of some Liangshan anchors. People question, who are the locals? What are the local products? Which are the true stories? What is script arrangement? Since the rise of short video platforms, users have curiously turned their perspectives to the countryside and no longer have to imagine life in a different place in their minds. Through the lens of local people, people saw the scenery and culture, and also ate fruits and vegetables sent from the local area.

;

;This time, the relevant departments of Liangshan Prefecture launched a special campaign to "clarify and strictly rectify the 'self-media' chaos" and disclosed "miserable auctions", "false aid to farmers", "fake charity", etc. Violations of laws and regulations; 54 suspects were arrested, including 11 Internet celebrity anchors involved, 5 MCN institutions were destroyed, and 14 companies involved were seized.

;

;Among them, the most attention-grabbing ones are that accounts with more than 2 million followers including "Xiao Yu", "Zhao Ling'er", "Liangshan Qubu" and "Liangshan Mengyang" have been permanently suspended. These anchors have The huge fan base once harvested a lot of sympathy, tears and wallets. So far, in the comment areas of related news, some fans still believe that they are innocent.

;

;Seven departments including the State Cyberspace Administration of China announced in 2021 The "Online Live Marketing Management Measures (Trial)" was promulgated on April 16, and the State Administration for Market Regulation promulgated the "Internet Advertising Management Measures" on February 25, 2023. Lawyer Feng Shengfan explained to Southern Weekend reporters: "This shows that the state Already aware of the chaos in the live streaming industry and the harm it brings, I believe that higher-level laws and related policies will be introduced in the near future. ”

;

;;Liangshan Grand Stage, come if you have talent;

;

;The Zhaojue County Public Security Bureau opened a case and found out that in July 2022, Chengdu Xiaoyu Zhang, the person in charge of Zhu Nong Media Co., Ltd. (MCN organization), came to Liangshan and found individual industrial and commercial households Zhao (female, Han nationality, 27 years old), Ari (male, Yi, 23 years old) and other "Internet celebrity seedlings" " and began to incubate carefully. In less than a year, the number of followers of the two accounts "Zhao Ling'er" and "Liangshan Qubu" has exceeded 2 million, and they have brought goods to cash.

;

;In the eyes of some fans, Qu Bu was deceived. A Sannong video blogger named "Wang Ershuai" who is familiar with these Daliangshan Internet celebrities explained in a live broadcast on the evening of September 22, "I just said that I was bribed with money." "Everything they did was negotiated." He gave an example. After selling for 10 million, the company received 3 million, but the boss took away the majority, and Qu Bu got 500,000 to 600,000. Zhao Ling'er was a little higher than Qu Bu. , "You are an amateur. You are nothing. You used to tighten screws in a factory. Will you do anything if I am given such a platform?" You can’t make so much money by tightening screws for a lifetime.”

;

;Nong Ge, a agriculture video blogger who has been in the industry for many years, told Southern Weekend reporters that some agriculture bloggers around him would hire local actors to perform. This is A semi-public secret in the industry, "It costs a few hundred yuan to hire an actor. Some actors are quite expensive and you can't even hire them for a few hundred yuan." (Because) If you call any farmer or ordinary person, it will be obvious in front of the camera. Many people have camera phobia. ”

;

;Nong Ge said that some professional actors cost about one or two thousand yuan to shoot one or two jokes, but there are more “temporary hires”. These jokes are similar: meeting local farmers and having kind conversations, expressing He acted like he was helping others, and paired it with tragic music. "As soon as the music started, everyone thought this anchor was awesome, really good. "Using the same routine, bloggers started to tour the country, going to Hainan Island to sell pineapples, to Fujian to sell grapefruits, etc. Such live broadcast rooms have good data and high sales.

;

;However, Internet celebrities from Daliang Mountain We were not satisfied with this, and implemented "iterative upgrades" based on the above-mentioned conventional routines.

;

;In August 2022, Zhao Ling'er appeared for the first time as a young man who returned to his hometown to help farmers and start businesses. "Qubu, a simple young man from the Yi ethnic group in Liangshan, began the story of Daliang Mountain. Zhao Ling'er emphasized that he and Qubu met by chance. "There is no team, let alone the capital and packaging of a big company as everyone talks about."

; < p>;Just three months ago, Xiao Yu, a "philanthropic blogger" who claimed to be shooting in Daliang Mountain, also "stumbled into the depths of lotus flowers" and met the simple and hard-working "Four Girls of Liangshan". Compare several Internet celebrities There are many similarities in the scenes, filming and scripts. Both are about encountering a single ethnic minority young man by chance, going to a stranger's house for dinner, killing a chicken to entertain him, taking out the bacon, and talking about the poor family situation during the meal. Established a deep friendship and created a relationship of assistance.

;

;Coincidentally, "Little Zhongxing China" also posted a video in October 2022, meeting "Shiyi", a Yi girl from Daliang Mountain . It is reported that, like Zhao Ling'er and Qu Bu, Eleven also signed a contract with this MCN organization in Chengdu.

;

;In October 2022, Xiaoyu published an oral story in the self-media "Interview with Real People" . He claimed to be from Shangqiu, Henan Province. He started engaging in e-commerce in 2018 and earned 1 million yuan in one year. He was initially inspired by the story of the "Cliff Village" in Daliang Mountain. After going there, he found that the rattan ladders had turned into steel bars. Ladder.

;

;However, in a series of videos he later planned, the local uninhabited production houses and dilapidated buildings in Gumo Village, Tebulo Township, Zhaojue County became theirs. Filming and live broadcast site. Local villager Hai Laihaqu said in an interview, "One day the lights suddenly came on in the old house that no one could live in, and I later found out that they were filming videos and live broadcasts there."

; < p>;When Xiaoyu was delivering supplies in Daliang Mountain, a local photographer asked to take pictures. "What surprised me was that I only spent seven or eight thousand yuan on the last batch of supplies, but netizens gave rewards or gifts for the total amount About ten to twenty thousand. "Xiaoyu has since tasted the sweetness and plunged into Daliang Mountain.

;

;On July 22, 2022, Chengdu Xiaoyu Zhunong Media Co., Ltd. was established. A month later, Zhao Ling'er's account released an encounter with Qubu video. Qubu is similar to Ding Zhen, who became popular in 2020. They are both from remote villages, with dark skin, handsome face and innocent smile. He is considered to have the potential of an internet celebrity.

;

;Wang Ershuai remembered that when he first came to Daliang Mountain, Xiao Yu told him that if he wanted to truly understand the people in the mountains, he had to eat and live here. Make friends with them for a little money." According to media reports, Xiaoyu's team did not communicate much with local villagers in Daliang Mountain, but when they needed villagers to appear on camera, they would give them some money. They rented several local houses and They grow corn on the land and cook on the mountain.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter asked Wang Ershuai in the live broadcast room how to tell the authenticity of Internet celebrities. Wang Ershuai replied: "You can tell the difference clearly after watching it too much." Come on... you can analyze it yourself. I can tell you about the things that have been revealed now. I will not talk about the things that have not been revealed. After all, people still rely on this thing to make a living and make money. ”

;

;;

;

;With the support of short video platforms for content that helps farmers, Daliang Mountain has become a traffic hotspot.;(Visual China/Photo) ;

;

;;The track selected by traffic;

;

;Xiaoyu is not the earliest Daliangshan Internet celebrity. The Liangshan Public Security Bureau discovered that since 2020 , Tang Mou, the head of Chengdu Aowei Culture Media Co., Ltd. (MCN Organization), used scripts, staged shots, etc. to incubate "Liangshan Mengyang" (Axi Moumou, female) with more than three million fans on the short video platform. Yi nationality, 21 years old), and "Liangshan Aze" (A's certain, male, Yi nationality, 21 years old).

;

;According to a previous report by "China News Weekly", some fans went there out of sympathy in 2019 Jiqu Village, Bier Town, Zhaojue County, where "Liangshan Mengyang" is located, discovered that the place where Mengyang often shoots videos is actually a place where local farmers raise cattle and sheep, and Mengyang's family background is not bad, and he is considered wealthy in the village . Meng Yang dropped out of school early and worked in Guangdong. Villagers believe that Meng Yang’s fortune is inseparable from “meeting a good boss.”

;

;Liangshan Prefecture Police stated that the above-mentioned illegal and criminal acts are well-organized and confusing. The case is strong and involves a wide range of areas, forming a gray industrial chain of counterfeiting and selling in recent years, including front-end creation of characters, incubation of Internet celebrities, mid-end script shooting, e-commerce operations, end-end supply of agricultural products, and traffic realization.

;

; Why are these MCN institutions so keen on "mining gold" in Daliang Mountain?

;

;Wang Huilin, a senior practitioner of agricultural products e-commerce, analyzed that Daliang Mountain is a natural reservoir of products and traffic. First of all, Daliang Mountain's The products have become popular among Internet celebrities; secondly, the topic of Daliang Mountain caters to traffic, “Daliang Mountain has ethnic minorities, beautiful scenery, and rich cultural heritage. People are rare for these few things, which solves the biggest traffic problem. " Wang Huilin told Southern Weekend reporters, "The economic development of Daliang Mountain is relatively slower than that of coastal areas, and with the attribute of helping farmers, this matter will develop more logically. ”

;

;Not only Daliang Mountain, but also Xinjiang and Inner Mongolia, places with “products, scenery, people, and culture” are sought after.

;

;Nong Ge believes: "It's more credible to shoot there. There must be a choice. Why doesn't anyone choose to go to Zhejiang to help farmers? "According to his many years of experience in carrying goods in the countryside, many short video bloggers like Meng Yang are suspected of exaggerating the misery of the countryside.

;

;A farmer practitioner from a mountainous area in the north told Southern Weekend reporter, people always have a prejudice against mountainous areas. In fact, including the business environment, some local things may be better than those in developed cities, but these have no attention and traffic. "There is no electricity in mountainous areas in xx", this topic is With traffic.

;

;Supporting farmers has become the focus of short video platforms. On September 12, the first "Kuaishou Light Chasing Conference" announced the launch of Kuaishou Village Broadcasting "Stars Project", which will be launched in the next three years. Invest 10 billion traffic and 50 million cash to cultivate 1 million village broadcasters and 1,000 rural entrepreneurs, and provide talents to 160 key national assistance counties. On September 21, Douyin E-commerce released the "2023 Harvest Festival Douyin E-commerce" "Agricultural Assistance Data Report", the number of short videos of trailers selling agricultural products on Douyin e-commerce is 21.86 million, and the total time of explaining agricultural products in the live broadcast room is 37.78 million hours. Fujian, Henan, Yunnan, Anhui and Sichuan have become the agricultural products on the platform. Businesses originate from the top five provinces.

;

;Liangshan Prefecture Police released the script of the MCN agency’s agriculture and rural areas video, which includes “collecting mountain goods”. For example, Shiyi and her cousin went to local villagers with scales, bags, backpacks, etc. Collect mountain goods at home.

;

;The script of rural areas and farmers caters to the traffic algorithm of short video platforms in disguise. Nie Wenchang, chairman of an e-commerce group in Shandong, established one of the first live broadcast bases in Linyi. He told Southern Weekend reporters Analysis, "The popularity will be high after the script is written. It is done according to some rules of the platform to boost the popularity. ”他说，乡村生活的主题拥有广泛共鸣。

;

;王惠林认为，这些视频之所以火爆，原因在于触发了平台的机制，“数据反馈，而非人为反馈”。数据指标判断这是一个“好”视频，更多的流量便会注入。大凉山网红的粉丝积累速度，从平台的逻辑来看，是正常的。

;

;王惠林告诉南方周末记者，这些剧本缺乏正常的生活逻辑，套路也不新鲜，但是刷短视频往往是感情驱动，不需要思考逻辑。

;

;关于此次大凉山网红事件，南方周末记者拨打多个助农文化传媒公司电话，或无法接通，或缄默不言。

;

;;看似助农，实为卖货;

;

;利用虚假人设吸引到粉丝后，上述公司会开设网店和直播带货，打着“助农”“优质原生态”等旗号，从外地食品公司低价购入蜂蜜、核桃等农副产品，假冒“大凉山特色农产品”商标，以次充好、以假充真在全国范围内销售。警方介绍，“凉山孟阳”所在的公司还雇用网络水军，在直播间制造爆款、抢单的假象，诱导消费者购买。

;

;孟阳曾在直播间里兴奋地喊，“你们给我刷礼物的钱，你们买了核桃，相当于支持了我们这边很多的叔叔阿姨老百姓，知道吧？ ”事实上，上述公司带货的农产品只有极少数来自本地，大部分是从外地低价购得。

;

;农哥不赞同这种助农的方式，他卖了几年的农产品，一直自称“贩子”。“在镜头面前说我们多可怜，利用别人的善良去挣钱，大多数人很容易相信”。

;

;冯胜钒分析，虚假人设、虚构产地等情形已构成虚假广告的范畴，而一旦涉及虚假广告，主播及其所在的MCN机构如存在明知的主观故意，则可能需要承担刑事、民事、行政三种不同的法律责任。

;

;即使带货产品确实来自产地，但是通过编造故事和立人设售卖的行为也可能违法。冯胜钒告诉南方周末记者，“虽然产品的产地是真实的，但是消费者是基于主播编造的故事及人设，产生助农的同情心才愿意下单的。所以主播编造故事、立人设同样构成虚假宣传中捏造、虚构、歪曲事实的误导性方式。 ”

;

;谷莫村的村书记俄的克布说，“我们谷莫村这么小的地方，没得那么多的蜂蜜，他是骗人的，没有帮助过，农户认都不认得他嘞！ ”

;

;直播电商企业辛选集团的有关人士告诉南方周末记者，一些地方出现农产品滞销问题，分销渠道也较少，公益助农项目旨在帮助当地打开销路，带动就业、助力振兴。农产品相比于其他品类，更容易出问题，利润率偏低，还需要投入大量的人力、资源。

;

;相对于头部企业，地方供应链质量参差不齐。王惠林介绍，业内常见的模式是，网红公司找到当地合适的供应链，谈好合作后，通过短视频平台建立链接。

;

;据南方周末记者了解，网红直播带货抽成，农产品一般抽成大概在20%左右，高一点的产品能到30%。

;

;一些大凉山网红带货的产品来自于成都蒲江县的供应链，王惠林提醒，这并不意味着这些供应链商的货品不是来自于大凉山，或许是为了节约物流成本，“新疆的哈密瓜有可能是从西安发货”。据凉山州警方披露，入狱的凉山网红选择的供应链并非真正从大凉山拿货。

;

;另外一种常见的模式，是由供应链商培育网红和发掘网红。《中国新闻周刊》披露，多位凉山大网红曾和供应链商任彦兵合作，售卖其产品。南方周末记者以合作者身份联系上了任彦兵，他称，“这生意不好做，准备改行了”。这位供应商并未受到此次凉山网红事件的波及。

;

;聂文昌说，比起其他品类，农产品有特殊性，农民手中的农产品质量参差不齐，即使消费者拿到异地农产品也难辨真假。

;

;如今，部分网红的违法行为对大凉山特产已造成负面影响。面对质疑，一些销售者不得不做出特别解释。一家主打售卖大凉山农家纯燕麦粉的店铺，其营业资质却显示在云南省昆明市盘龙区。主播解释，店铺是粉丝给办的，但发货地址就是自己家。而另一家号称售卖四川大凉山丑苹果的店铺，经营地址在海南省海口市。商家在直播间解释说，这是之前在海南卖凤梨时注册的地址，并且掏出手机询问“Hi，Siri，现在的海拔高度是多少”？Siri给了一个2515米的回答。

;

;（应受访者要求，农哥为匿名）

;The 2023 National Medical Insurance Fund unannounced inspection has officially started in late August, focusing on medical imaging Examination, clinical examination, and rehabilitation are three areas where problems reported by the public are relatively concentrated. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Medical insurance funds are the "life-saving money" for citizens to seek medical treatment. How to regulate them has attracted much attention from all walks of life.

;

;"In the first half of 2023, the national medical insurance department inspected a total of 390,000 designated medical institutions, dealt with 160,000 illegal institutions, and recovered 6.34 billion yuan in medical insurance-related funds. Since 2018, a total of 83.5 billion has been recovered Yuan." On September 22, 2023, Gu Rong, deputy director of the Fund Supervision Department of the National Medical Insurance Administration, said at a regular press conference in the second half of 2023.

;

;It is reported that the 2023 National Medical Insurance Fund unannounced inspection has officially started in late August. In 2023, the national unannounced inspections will cover 31 provinces across the country and the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps, focusing on medical imaging examinations, clinical examinations, and rehabilitation, three areas where problems reported by the public are concentrated. At the same time, designated retail pharmacies were included in the inspection targets for the first time. So far, it has carried out unannounced inspections in 15 provinces including Guizhou, Shaanxi, Sichuan, Xinjiang, and Shanghai.

;

;Gu Rong revealed that many provinces have also carried out provincial unannounced inspections based on the national model. In the first half of this year, provincial unannounced inspections have covered 488 designated medical institutions and 30 medical insurance agencies in 84 prefectures and cities. Institutions, 298 illegal institutions were dealt with, and 210 million yuan in medical insurance-related funds were recovered.

;

;;Monitoring;;Using;;Big Data and Artificial Intelligence;

;

;The National Medical Insurance Administration has been used for 5 consecutive years Cooperate with the public security and health departments to carry out special rectification to crack down on fraud and insurance fraud. In 2023, the procuratorial organs and financial departments will also join in, making the advantages of joint punishment more prominent.

;

;Gu Rong introduced that the special rectification in 2023 will focus on key areas such as "orthopedics, hemodialysis, intracardiac, examination, testing, rehabilitation and physical therapy", focusing on key pharmaceutical consumables that rank high in medical insurance settlement costs, focusing on Regarding key behaviors such as false medical treatment and reselling of medical insurance drugs, we strive to investigate and deal with a number of key cases, crack down on a number of illegal activities, and standardize a number of special areas.

;

;Medical insurance data is huge and complicated, and the role of big data and social supervision cannot be ignored.

;

;In 2023, the National Medical Insurance Administration will select 11 provinces and 53 coordinating districts across the country to carry out pilot projects for the application and supervision of big data in anti-fraud in medical insurance, and encourage medical insurance departments at all levels to use new technologies such as big data and artificial intelligence. Strive to achieve full coverage of the intelligent supervision subsystem in all coordinated areas as soon as possible to form a national intelligent monitoring "one network".

;

;In the first half of 2023, the country intelligently reviewed and monitored non-payments and recovered 980 million yuan of medical insurance funds. Through handling mass reports, 42.33 million yuan of medical insurance funds were recovered and administrative penalties of 7.65 million yuan were imposed.

;

;;

;

;On the morning of September 22, 2023, the National Medical Insurance Administration held a regular press conference for the second half of 2023. ;(National Medical Insurance Bureau official website/picture);

;

;;March to August;;,; ;Negotiated drugs have reduced the burden on patients by 109.7 billion yuan;

;

;At the same time, every adjustment to the national medical insurance catalog also affects the minds of thousands of families.

;

;The 2022 version of the National Medical Insurance Directory was officially implemented on March 1, 2023, and has been in operation for nearly seven months. This version of the catalog adds 111 new drugs, covering multiple treatment fields such as oncology, immunity, rare diseases, and anti-infections. Among them, 91 drugs such as orebatinib, sarvotinib, and rispalan have been admitted through negotiation. By adding new drugs to the catalog, the total number of drugs negotiated for medical insurance during the agreement period reached 346.

;

;"From March to August 2023, a total of 123 million people were reimbursed for negotiated drugs during 346 agreement periods, with medical insurance fund expenditures of 49.17 billion yuan, and the average actual reimbursement ratio was 69.7%. The dual factors of superimposed price reduction and medical insurance reimbursement , in the six months from March to August, 346 types of negotiated drugs have reduced the burden on patients by 109.7 billion yuan." Huang Xinyu, director of the Pharmaceutical Management Department of the National Medical Insurance Administration, said.

;

;As of the end of August 2023, 234,000 designated medical institutions across the country have been equipped with negotiated drugs during the agreement period, including 65,000 designated medical institutions, 169,000 designated retail pharmacies, and 91 in 2022. The newly added negotiated drugs have been deployed in 55,000 designated pharmaceutical institutions.

;

;The adjustment of the 2023 version of the National Medical Insurance Catalog is also in progress. The application was launched on July 1, and the list of applied drugs that passed the formal review was announced in early September. Including 224 drugs outside the catalog and 164 drugs in the catalog, a total of 388 drugs passed the formal review.

;

;“We will carry out review, calculation and negotiation work as planned, and expect to announce the results of this year’s catalog adjustment in early December, and implement the new version of the catalog from January 1 next year.” Huang Xinyu said.

; Mon, 25 Sep 2023 17:25:04 +0800 《关于依法惩治网络暴力违法犯罪的指导意见》出台http://www.infzm.com/contents/257621
;;2023-09-25 15:34:00;
;

;Although the Internet is a virtual space, it is by no means an illegal place. Those who wantonly publish abuses and insults against individuals on the Internet Cyber ​​violence that spreads rumors, defamation, invades privacy and other information must be subject to due legal sanctions. On September 25, the Supreme People's Court, the Supreme People's Procuratorate, and the Ministry of Public Security jointly held a press conference to officially release the "Guiding Opinions on Punishing Internet Violence and Crime According to the Law."

;

;The "Opinions" have a total of 20 articles, mainly covering ten aspects:

;

;First, clarify the applicable rules for the crime of online violence. The "Opinions" provide guidance on the nature of online violence in accordance with the criminal law and relevant judicial interpretations. Specifically, those who openly insult others or fabricate facts to slander others on the information network, if the circumstances are serious, will be convicted and punished for the crimes of insult and slander; organize "human flesh searches" to illegally collect and release citizens' personal information to an unspecified majority of people, and the circumstances are In serious cases, they will be convicted and punished for the crime of infringing on citizens' personal information. In addition, the crime of illegal use of information network can be applied to malicious marketing and hype behaviors carried out through cyber violence incidents; the crime of refusing to perform information network security management obligations can be applied to the behavior of failing to perform information network security management obligations in accordance with the law for discovered cyber violence information .

;

;The second is to clarify the rules for handling illegal online violence. For online violence, we should adhere to multi-dimensional and joint governance and improve the connection mechanism between administrative law enforcement and criminal justice. The "Opinions" stipulate that the implementation of online insults, slander and other online violence does not constitute a crime. If it complies with the provisions of the Public Security Management Punishment Law and other provisions, administrative penalties will be imposed in accordance with the law.

;

;The third is to clarify the policy principles for punishing cyber violence crimes. The "Opinions" require that the spirit of severe punishment for cyber violence crimes should be reflected so that the people can fully feel fairness and justice. Adhere to strict law enforcement and justice, strictly investigate cyber violence crimes in accordance with the law, and effectively correct the erroneous tendency of "the law does not punish the public". We must focus on cracking down on malicious initiators, organizers, malicious promoters, and those who persist in reforming despite repeated abuses. The "Opinions" also stipulate that there are those who commit cyber violence against minors and disabled people, organize "trolls" and "thugs" to commit cyber violence, fabricate "sexually related" topics to infringe on the human dignity of others, and use "deep synthesis" and other generative methods If artificial intelligence technology releases illegal information, or if network service providers initiate or organize cyber violence, they will be severely punished in accordance with the law.

;

;The fourth is to clarify the boundaries between illegal crimes and legal behaviors of online violence. The "Opinions" stipulate that reporting or exposing other people's crimes or violations of laws and disciplines through information networks should not be considered a defamation crime as long as they do not intentionally fabricate facts or knowingly spread the facts to be fabricated. Commenting and criticizing other people's words and deeds, even if the views are biased or the speech is extreme, as long as it is not wanton abuse or malicious slander, it should not be considered an insult or crime.

;

;The fifth is to clarify the work requirements for public security organs to assist in evidence collection. According to the provisions of the Criminal Law, in cases where the victim files a private prosecution for online insult or defamation, if the people's court determines after review that it is indeed difficult for the victim to provide evidence, it may request the public security organs to provide assistance. The "Opinions" reiterate the provisions of the Criminal Law, and also clarify that the public security organs should promptly identify the perpetrators of online insults and slander according to the requirements of the People's Court and the specific circumstances of the case, and collect evidence and materials such as the spread and spread of relevant information and the impact caused. Network service providers shall provide necessary technical support and assistance for public security organs to obtain evidence in accordance with the law.

;

;The sixth is to clarify the public prosecution standards for criminal cases of online insult and defamation. According to the provisions of the Criminal Law, those who commit crimes of insult or slander and seriously endanger social order and national interests shall be prosecuted in accordance with the law. The "Opinions" stipulate that in cases of online insult and defamation, public prosecution procedures will apply if one of the following circumstances occurs: (1) causing serious consequences such as mental disorder or suicide of the victim or his close relatives, and causing a bad impact on society; (2) arbitrarily using The general public is the target of infringement, and relevant information is widely disseminated on the Internet, triggering a large number of vulgar and malicious comments, seriously disrupting the order of the Internet, and having a bad impact on society; (3) Insulting and slandering multiple people or spreading insulting and slanderous information multiple times, causing social harm Those with a bad impact; (4) Organizing and instigating people to spread a large amount of insulting and slanderous information on multiple online platforms, with a bad impact on society; (5) Other situations that seriously endanger social order.

;

;The seventh is to clarify the transition process from private prosecution to public prosecution in criminal cases of online insult and defamation. The "Opinions" stipulate that for online insults and slander that seriously endanger social order, the public security organs have filed a case as a public prosecution case, and the victim simultaneously files a private prosecution in the People's Court, the People's Court may request the private prosecutor to withdraw the private prosecution or rule not to accept it; it has been accepted If the case is found, a ruling should be made to terminate the trial and the relevant materials should be transferred to the public security organs. The original private prosecutor can participate in the lawsuit as a victim. The victim files a private prosecution before the public security organ files a case. If, upon review, the people's court determines that the relevant online insults and defamation seriously endanger social order, the case shall be transferred to the public security organ.

;

;Eighth, support civil rights protection against online violence in accordance with the law. The "Opinions" stipulate that if cyber violence is committed against others and infringes on others' reputation rights, privacy rights and other personality rights, and the victim requests the perpetrator to bear civil liability, the people's court will support it in accordance with the law. If the right holder has evidence to prove that the perpetrator is committing or is about to commit an illegal act that infringes upon his or her personality rights, and failure to stop it in time will cause irreparable damage to his or her legitimate rights and interests, the people's court may, upon the right holder's application, issue an injunction against infringement of personality rights in accordance with the law.

;

;The ninth is to clarify the rules for public interest litigation in cases of online violence. The "Opinions" stipulate that if online violence harms public interests, the People's Procuratorate may file a public interest litigation with the People's Court in accordance with the law. If a network service provider fails to perform its information network security management obligations in accordance with the law for discovered cyber violence information, resulting in the large-scale dissemination of illegal information or other serious circumstances that harm the public interest, the People's Procuratorate may file a public interest litigation with the People's Court in accordance with the law. When handling public interest litigation cases in the field of cyber violence control, the People's Procuratorate may require network service providers to provide necessary technical support and assistance in accordance with the law.

;

;The tenth is to proactively perform duties and promote comprehensive management of cyber violence. The "Opinions" require that when handling cases of cyber violence, information on the progress of the case should be released to the public in a timely manner in accordance with the law, clarify the truth, and eliminate the adverse effects of cyber violence, so as to reduce the harm to the victims and help the victims get out of their predicaments; carry out legal publicity and give full play to law enforcement The role of rule guidance, value orientation and behavioral norms in handling cases is to educate and guide netizens to consciously abide by the law and lead social civilization; to conduct in-depth analysis of the root causes that promote the occurrence of online violence, promote multi-dimensional co-governance of online violence, and fundamentally reduce online violence occurrence, creating a clear cyberspace.

; Mon, 25 Sep 2023 15:55:02 +0800 孙一文止步八强，新旧交替的女子重剑队亟待历练http://www.infzm.com/contents/257567
;;2023-09-25 15:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On September 24, 2023, women's individual epee four in the fencing event of the Hangzhou Asian Games In the quarter-finals, Chinese player Sun Yiwen (right) lost to South Korean player Song Shiluo 12-14 ; (Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;12 to 14, on September 24, the first official competition day of the Hangzhou Asian Games, in the quarter-finals of the women’s individual epee fencing event at the Hangzhou Asian Games, Chinese player Sun Yiwen lost to South Korean player Song Se-ra and stopped in the quarterfinals. So far, all Chinese players in this project have been eliminated.

;

;This is Sun Yiwen’s third Asian Games trip. She and her teammates won the women's epee team championship twice before. At the last Asian Games in Jakarta, Sun Yiwen also reached the finals of individual events, but ultimately lost to South Korean star Kang Young-mi and won a silver medal.

;

;“This sport pays great attention to variety, balance, game and precision.” A game lasts up to 9 minutes. If you hit at the same time, you must be 1/25 second earlier than the opponent to score. A blink of an eye is 0.75 seconds, which is enough to turn the tide or give up victory. To do this, fencers need to "count one step at a time." Excellent fencers are often in a "man-sword-in-one" state, that is, under various circumstances, they can hit the opponent's exposed effective parts (including the torso, legs, feet, hands, arms, and helmets) at the fastest speed and the shortest route. . Behind the "subconscious" sword thrusts again and again is the muscle memory cultivated over many years.

;

;Tokyo Olympic champion Sun Yiwen is the number one Chinese women's epee player. He has always been good at "stopping with stillness and attacking later." "Determined, calm, and explosive" is how she sums up her playing style. However, after winning the Tokyo Olympics and Xi'an Games, Sun Yiwen has been trapped by injuries and will not resume training until October 2022 and systematically participate in events. To "find the feeling of starting over", the road is rough. Sun Yiwen once lamented that he "can't even play games anymore" and was "very unfamiliar." It was not until the International Fencing Federation World Cup Barcelona in February 2023 that he gradually regained his form and won two bronze medals in a row, both individual and team.

;

;;

;

;On July 24, 2021, Sun Yiwen (right) celebrated with his coach after winning the women's individual epee final in fencing at the Tokyo Olympics;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;In previous interviews with the media, Sun Yiwen once said that winning a gold medal is not necessary for this comeback. After reviewing the schedule performance of the last Olympic Games, she and the coaching staff found that although they won the gold medal, many problems and deficiencies were still exposed in the process. If they can be improved, the state will be better than before. "There is a new coach in the team who has taught me many new ideas and moves. Now I dare to try new moves in the game and explore new areas. This is what makes me most interesting and what makes me happy." The reason why I decided to stick to another Olympic cycle is that I am still learning."

;

;After the Tokyo Olympics, the Chinese fencing team is facing a transitional period of replacement of old and new players and adjustment of the coaching team. Three-quarters of the athletes participating in the Asian Games have never competed in the Tokyo Olympics. The Hangzhou Asian Games is regarded as an important training opportunity for this young team to prepare for the Paris Olympics. According to the competition plan, the fencing competition of the Hangzhou Asian Games will be held from September 24th to 29th, with a total of 12 gold medals produced. On September 27, Sun Yiwen will also lead his young teammates to continue their pursuit of medals in the women's epee team competition.

;

;As Zhang Xin, Secretary-General of the Chinese Sports Delegation at the Hangzhou Asian Games and Director of the Competitive Sports Department of the State Sports General Administration, said, the Hangzhou Asian Games is the "high school entrance examination" before the Paris Olympics. Less than a year later, 32-year-old Sun Yiwen will usher in her third Olympic trip in Paris, and before that, she and the young Chinese fencing team still need to overcome many obstacles.

;

;;

;

;On June 20, 2023, in the 2023 Asian Fencing Championships Women’s Epee Team Third Place Competition held in Wuxi, Jiangsu, the Chinese team defeated the Japanese team and won the bronze medal. Chinese team players Tang Junyao (first from left), Lin Sheng (second from left), Zhu Mingye (third from left) and Sun Yiwen took a group photo after the game ; (Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;;Behind the "Duel of Swords";

;

;Sun Yiwen never considered himself a "talented player". She attributes her gains in her career to her seriousness and stubbornness.

;

;Sun Yiwen was born in Wanggezhuang Village, Qixia City, Yantai, Shandong Province in 1992. When she was young, her health was very poor and she would catch a cold every winter. Sun Yiwen's father, Sun Hongming, is a local village doctor. Under his father's supervision and company, she has developed the habit of running and exercising since she was a child. Long-term persistence pays off. In elementary school, Sun Yiwen had become the school's top sports student. When he was 11 years old, Sun Yiwen was selected by the Qixia Sports and Competition School to focus on middle and long-distance running. Two years later, she had grown to 1.66 meters, and her best standing long jump score was over 2.5 meters. Because of her tallness, long wingspan, strong instantaneous explosive power, and being left-handed, she was spotted by Xu Zhaowei, the then head coach of the Yantai City Fencing Team, and officially embarked on the road of fencing.

;

;Fencing is a project that requires very comprehensive abilities. "Strength, speed, explosive power, endurance, coordination, flexibility, and thinking", none of them can be missing. The initial training was hard and boring. Morning training starts at 5:30 in the morning. Basic steps and movements last for several hours. In order to develop their endurance shortcomings, the team members also need to receive additional running training. From Monday to Friday, I run 3,000 meters in the morning and evening, and there is also a 6-kilometer cross-country race on the weekends. If you fail to complete the task within the stipulated time, you will be fined. The longer it takes, the greater the fine. After the high-intensity training during the day, there are cultural classes in the evening.

;

;After a week, Sun Yiwen wanted to give up. In order to comfort and encourage his daughter, Sun Hongming rushed to Yantai from his hometown and stayed with his daughter for two days. After the initial adaptation period, Sun Yiwen, who is physically fit and good at thinking, began to gradually emerge. "Every time I practice an action and I can't do it, I will carefully review it and think about why. Every time I win or lose a game, I will dig deeper into the underlying logic."
